### Real Numbers

$$\text{set of positive integers}  = \{1,2,3,...\}$$
$$\text{set of integers} = \{...,-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3,...\}$$
$$\text{set of rational numbers} = \{...,-2,...,-\frac{3}{2},...,0,\frac{1}{4},...,\frac{2}{1}...\}$$
(terminating or nonterminating repeating decimals)
$$\text{set of irrational numbers} = \{...,0,...,\sqrt{2},...,e,...,\pi,...,\}$$

### Properties of real numbers

|    |Property      |Example                   |
|:---|:------------:|:------------------------:|
|1   |$a-b=a+(-b)$  |$3-8=3+(-8)=-5$           |
|2   |$a-(-b)=a+b$  |$4-(-3)=4+3=7$            |
|3   |$-a=(-1)(a)$  |$-30=(-1)(30)$            |
|4   |$a(b+c)=ab+ac$|$3(2+6)=3\times2+3\times6$|
|5   |$a(b-c)=ab-ac$|$3(2-6)=3\times2-3\times6$|  
|... |...           |   ...                    |
|18  |$a(\frac{b}{a}=b)$|$7(\frac{3}{7}) = 3$  |
|...|...|...|
|20 |$\frac{a}{b}\times\frac{c}{d} = \frac{ac}{bd}$|$\frac{3}{2}\times\frac{5}{9} = \frac{3\times5}{2\times9}$|
|...|...|...|
|27 |$\frac{a}{b}+\frac{c}{d} = \frac{ad+bc}{bd}$|$\frac{3}{2}\times\frac{5}{9} = \frac{3\times5}{2\times9}$|
|...|...|...|
|29 |$\frac{\frac{a}{b}}{\frac{c}{d}}=\frac{a}{b}\div\frac{c}{d} = \frac{a}{b}\times\frac{d}{c}$|$\frac{\frac{2}{3}}{\frac{7}{5}}=\frac{2}{3}\div\frac{7}{5} = \frac{2}{3}\times\frac{5}{7}$|
|...|...|...|

### Exponents and Radicals

$$x^n = x\times x \times x \times ... \times x$$
for n factors

$$x^{-n} = \frac{1}{x^n}$$

$$\frac{1}{x^{-n}} = x^{n}$$
$$x^0 = 1 \text{    if    } x\neq 0$$

$$x^{k/n} = (\sqrt[n]{x})^{k}$$

### What is a function?

![Domain vs Range](domainrange.png)

***


"A *function* is a rule that assigns to each input number exactly one output number. The set of all input numbers to which the rule applies is called the *domain* of the function. The set of all output numbers is called the *range*"

### Linear Functions

```{r}
ggplot(data.frame(x = c(0,7)), aes(x)) + 
  stat_function(fun = function(x)1.5*x+2) +
  xlab("x") +
  ylab("f(x)")
```

***

$$f(x) = ax+b$$

For example:

$$f(x) = 1.5x+2$$
a is the slope, b is the intercept

### Quadratic functions

```{r}
ggplot(data.frame(x = c(-30,30)), aes(x)) + 
  stat_function(fun = function(x)1.5*x^2 + 2 * x, color = "red", show.legend = TRUE) +
  stat_function(fun = function(x)-2*x^2 + x + 1,color = "blue", show.legend = TRUE) +
  xlab("x") +
  ylab("f(x)") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0)
```
***

**Standard function:**
$$f(x) = ax^2 +bx+c$$

for example:

\begin{align*}
f(x) = 1.5x^2 + 2x \\
g(x) = -2x^2 + x + 1 
\end{align*}

$$\text{vertex} = -\frac{b}{2a}$$
$$\text{y-intercept} = c$$

### abc-formula

$$\begin {align*}
ax^2 + bx + c = 0 \\
4a^2x^2 + 4abx + 4ac = 0 \\ 
4a^2x^2 + 4abx = -4ac \\
4a^2x^2 +4abx + b^2 = b^2 - 4ac \\
(2ax + b)^2 = b^2 - 4ac \\
2ax + b = \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac} \\
2ax = -b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac} \\
x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a} \\
\end {align*}$$

### Polynomials

$$f(x) = c_{n}x^{n}+c_{n-1}x^{n-1}+...+c_1x+c_0$$

$$f(x) = 9x^5 + 2x^2 + 19$$

```{r}
ggplot(data.frame(x = c(-30,30)), aes(x)) + 
  stat_function(fun = function(x)9 * x^5 + 2 * x^2 + 19) +
  xlab("x") +
  ylab("f(x)") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0)
```

***

This is a 5th degree polynomial

### Absolute function

$$f(x) = |x|$$

```{r}
ggplot(data.frame(x = c(-30,30)), aes(x)) + 
  stat_function(fun = function(x)abs(x)) +
  xlab("x") +
  ylab("f(x)") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0)
```
